summary: This is an email from a prosecutor (Alison) to a supervisor (Ed) requesting approval for travel to Durango, Colorado to interview a victim and potential witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The travel is planned for April 12-15, 2021, to prepare for the trial scheduled for that summer.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Author of the email requesting travel approval to interview a victim/witness for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the case for which the travel and witness interview is being conducted.

connections.description: Alison is requesting travel approval from Ed, indicating a supervisor-subordinate or colleague relationship within the legal/prosecution team.
Alison is a prosecutor working on the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Travel to Interview Witness
events.description: Planned departure for prosecutors and case agents to travel to Durango, Colorado to interview a victim/potential witness.

events.title: Witness Interviews
events.description: Two days scheduled to debrief the victim and discuss testifying at the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Return Travel
events.description: Planned return from Durango, Colorado after completing the witness interviews.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial
events.description: The upcoming trial for Ghislaine Maxwell, for which the witness is being prepared to testify.

keyFacts: In April 2021, prosecutors were actively preparing for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial by traveling to interview a victim who was also a potential witness.
The travel involved a multi-day trip to Durango, Colorado, indicating the witness was located outside of the primary jurisdiction.
The email confirms the Ghislaine Maxwell trial was scheduled for the summer of 2021.
The correspondence shows standard internal procedures for travel approval within the prosecution team.
